sources.title: 20 Million Miles to Earth
sources.description: The first U.S. spaceship to Venus crash-lands off the coast of Sicily on its return trip. A dangerous, lizard-like creature comes with it and quickly grows gigantic.

sources.title: 20 Million Miles to Earth (restored, colorized) (1957, horror, imdb score: 6.4)
sources.description: 20 Million Miles to Earth (also known as The Beast from Space ) is a 1957 American horror science fiction monster film directed by Nathan Juran and starring William Hopper , Joan Taylor , and Frank Puglia . It was produced by Charles H. Schneer 's Morningside Productions for Columbia Pictures . The screenplay was written by Bob Williams and Christopher Knopf from an original treatment by Charlott Knight. As with several other Schneer-Columbia collaborations, the film was developed to showcase the stop-motion animation of Ray Harryhausen .

metadata.Plot: The first spaceship to visit Venus crash lands in the sea, freeing a small native Venusian creature called the Ymir. Eventually growing to enormous size, it threatens the city of Rome.
metadata.Writer: Robert Creighton Williams, Christopher Knopf, Charlott Knight
metadata.Actors: William Hopper, Joan Taylor, Thomas Browne Henry
